member.name: T:AskiaCore.IContext
member.summary:
Provide a context for requests execution, it's required for many API requests.
The context is created and its members values are filled by the software using AskiaCore, most of them help identify an entity by providing an id.

example.para: Create a new survey with one question

member.name: P:AskiaCore.IContext.UserId
member.summary: Id of the user making the request.

member.name: P:AskiaCore.IContext.SessionId
member.summary: Arbitrary session id in which the request is made. This session id should be the same for all requests made by a client session.
member.remarks: It's important to give the same session id for a better management of the undo/redo, logs etc...

member.name: M:AskiaCore.IInterview.MoveOn(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Try to save the answers and to move on the next visible page

remarks.para:
This method doesn't necesseraly move to the page that follow the current page.
According to the specified parameters, this method could:
- stay on the same page
- go to the previous visible page
- go to the next visible page
Notice that some routings and properties could redirect the respondent to a previous or to a far next page.

member.param: Respondent answers and web parameters
member.returns: Returns until a page is accessible

member.name: T:AskiaCore.RoutingConditionType
member.summary: Enumeration of the routing condition type

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingConditionType.Undefined
member.summary: Not defined

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingConditionType.Gui
member.summary: Defined with Design 5 graphical user interface

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingConditionType.Advanced
member.summary: Defined using Askia script

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingConditionType.Assisted
member.summary: Defined with Design 6 graphical user interface

member.name: T:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType
member.summary: Enumeration of the routing action type

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.Undefined
member.summary: Not defined

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.Skip
member.summary: Specifies part of the questionnaire (a question or chapter) that will not be asked if the routing condition is met.

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.Ask
member.summary: Specifically targets parts of the questionnaire which are to be asked only if the specified condition is met.

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.Goto
member.summary: Jumps immediately to the specified question. We recommend that you use "Do Not Ask" routing action wherever possible to skip sections of the questionnaire. This helps ensure that your questionnaire routing remains easy to understand.

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.AbandonInterview
member.summary: Terminates the current interview without saving the data or marking the interview as incomplete and records a specific call result code.

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.SetValue
member.summary: Records a specific value in the specified variable. Different values can be recorded, depending on whether the routing condition evaluates to true or false. Can also hide the variables (so it will not be visible to the agent or respondent).

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.ShowMessage
member.summary: Displays a message to the interviewer or respondent.The message can be set to "blocking": this means that the respondent will not be able to proceed until the routing instruction's condition is met.

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.IgnoreResponses
member.summary: Ignore the specified responses in a particular variable. These responses will not be displayed to the respondent, who therefore cannot select them.

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.ChangeQuestionOrder
member.summary: Changes the order of questions in the questionnaire for the current respondent (so the order in which he or she will answer the questionnaire changes).

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.ChangeResponseOrder
member.summary: Changes the order of the responses in the specified question, or the order of loop items within the specified loop, for the current respondent.

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.SetLanguage
member.summary: Specifies the language that will be used for the current interview.

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.SetScenario
member.summary: Changes the version of the questionnaire used for the current interview. The respondent will only be asked questions assigned to that particular version.

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.SendEmail
member.summary: Sends an email to a specific destination, with the specified subject line and message text.

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.RunSQL
member.summary: Initiates an SQL query. This can be used to store data in an external database. You must specify the databases DSN, and the appropriate SQL query.

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.RunProgram
member.summary: Starts the specified external program on the interviewers computer (or, for Askiaweb projects, on the respondents computer).

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.QueryWebService
member.summary: Sends an HTTP request to a web service

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.StartPredictiveDialing
member.summary: In a CATI project, sends a predictive dialling trigger to the telephony system.

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.StartRecording
member.summary: In a CATI project, this begins a recording of the telephone conversation.

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.InterruptRecording
member.summary: In a CATI project, this stops any in-progress recording.

member.name: F:AskiaCore.RoutingActionType.RunAskiaScript
member.summary: Runs the specified Askiascript 2.0 script. This allows you to carry out multiple actions (e.g. setting or skipping multiple questions) with a single routing instruction. There are several keywords that may be particularly useful with this routing type, as they are equivalent to various other routing actions.

member.name: T:AskiaCore.ISurvey
member.summary: Represents a survey

remarks.para:
The survey instance is created for a given context.
You can have multiple instances representing the same survey with different contexts,
they all will internally interact with the same reference of the survey data.
The concurrent management of survey with context is mostly done to allows edition by multiple users at the same time on the same survey.

example.para: Use two different survey instances to manipulate the same survey data

member.name: T:AskiaCore.Persistent
member.summary:
Helper methods to store persistent environment data.
It is important to note that persistent data is only kept in memory despite the name, restarting a process using AskiaCore would clear this data.
member.remarks: For .NET web project you may use the Global.asax to initialise the persistent settings

example.para: Management of the database connection in the Global.asax of the .NET web project
